revised_title: Spectroscopic Studies of Low-Pressure Flames: Evidence for Abnormally High Electronic Excitation
tldr: The authors conducted spectroscopic studies on low-pressure flames and discovered abnormally high electronic excitation in the reaction zones. This effect occurs in various hydrocarbon flames but not in flames of H2, CO, CS2, and formaldehyde. The cause of the abnormal excitation is discussed, and the spectrum-line reversal method of measuring flame temperatures is criticized.
